info.title: ApiManagementClient
info.description: Use these REST APIs for performing operations on User entity in Azure API Management deployment. The User entity in API Management represents the developers that call the APIs of the products to which they are subscribed.

get.description: Lists a collection of registered users in the specified service instance.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: serviceName
parameters.description: The name of the API Management service.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: |   Field     |     Usage     |     Supported operators     |     Supported functions     |</br>|-------------|-------------|-------------|-------------|</br>| name | filter | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith | </br>| firstName | filter | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith | </br>| lastName | filter | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith | </br>| email | filter | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith | </br>| state | filter | eq |     | </br>| registrationDate | filter | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt |     | </br>| note | filter | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith | </br>| groups | expand |     |     | </br>

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Number of records to return.

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Number of records to skip.

parameters.name: expandGroups
parameters.description: Detailed Group in response.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

200.description: Lists a collection of User entities.

groups.description: Collection of groups user is part of.

builtIn.description: true if the group is one of the three system groups (Administrators, Developers, or Guests); otherwise false.

description.description: Group description. Can contain HTML formatting tags.

externalId.description: For external groups, this property contains the id of the group from the external identity provider, e.g. for Azure Active Directory `aad://<tenant>.onmicrosoft.com/groups/<group object id>`; otherwise the value is null.

registrationDate.description: Date of user registration. The date conforms to the following format: `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ` as specified by the ISO 8601 standard.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

code.description: Service-defined error code. This code serves as a sub-status for the HTTP error code specified in the response.

details.description: The list of invalid fields send in request, in case of validation error.

code.description: Property level error code.

get.description: Gets the details of the user specified by its identifier.

appType.description: Determines the type of application which send the create user request. Default is old publisher portal.

confirmation.description: Determines the type of confirmation e-mail that will be sent to the newly created user.

email.description: Email address. Must not be empty and must be unique within the service instance.

password.description: User Password. If no value is provided, a default password is generated.

properties.description: Parameters supplied to the Create User operation.

get.description: Lists the collection of subscriptions of the specified user.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: serviceName
parameters.description: The name of the API Management service.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: User identifier. Must be unique in the current API Management service instance.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: |   Field     |     Usage     |     Supported operators     |     Supported functions     |</br>|-------------|-------------|-------------|-------------|</br>| name | filter | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith | </br>| displayName | filter | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith | </br>| stateComment | filter | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith | </br>| ownerId | filter | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith | </br>| scope | filter | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith | </br>| userId | filter | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith | </br>| productId | filter | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith | </br>

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Number of records to return.

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Number of records to skip.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

200.description: Lists a collection of Subscription entities.

createdDate.description: Subscription creation date. The date conforms to the following format: `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ` as specified by the ISO 8601 standard.

displayName.description: The name of the subscription, or null if the subscription has no name.

endDate.description: Date when subscription was cancelled or expired. The setting is for audit purposes only and the subscription is not automatically cancelled. The subscription lifecycle can be managed by using the `state` property. The date conforms to the following format: `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ` as specified by the ISO 8601 standard.

expirationDate.description: Subscription expiration date. The setting is for audit purposes only and the subscription is not automatically expired. The subscription lifecycle can be managed by using the `state` property. The date conforms to the following format: `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ` as specified by the ISO 8601 standard.

notificationDate.description: Upcoming subscription expiration notification date. The date conforms to the following format: `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ` as specified by the ISO 8601 standard.

ownerId.description: The user resource identifier of the subscription owner. The value is a valid relative URL in the format of /users/{userId} where {userId} is a user identifier.

primaryKey.description: Subscription primary key. This property will not be filled on 'GET' operations! Use '/listSecrets' POST request to get the value.

secondaryKey.description: Subscription secondary key. This property will not be filled on 'GET' operations! Use '/listSecrets' POST request to get the value.

startDate.description: Subscription activation date. The setting is for audit purposes only and the subscription is not automatically activated. The subscription lifecycle can be managed by using the `state` property. The date conforms to the following format: `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ` as specified by the ISO 8601 standard.

state.description: Subscription state. Possible states are * active – the subscription is active, * suspended – the subscription is blocked, and the subscriber cannot call any APIs of the product, * submitted – the subscription request has been made by the developer, but has not yet been approved or rejected, * rejected – the subscription request has been denied by an administrator, * cancelled – the subscription has been cancelled by the developer or administrator, * expired – the subscription reached its expiration date and was deactivated.

stateComment.description: Optional subscription comment added by an administrator.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

code.description: Service-defined error code. This code serves as a sub-status for the HTTP error code specified in the response.

details.description: The list of invalid fields send in request, in case of validation error.

code.description: Property level error code.

post.description: Gets the Shared Access Authorization Token for the User.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: serviceName
parameters.description: The name of the API Management service.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: User identifier. Must be unique in the current API Management service instance.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

expiry.description: The Expiry time of the Token. Maximum token expiry time is set to 30 days. The date conforms to the following format: `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ` as specified by the ISO 8601 standard.

keyType.description: The Key to be used to generate token for user.

properties.description: Parameters supplied to the Get User Token operation.

200.description: The response body contains the authorization token for the user.

value.description: Shared Access Authorization token for the User.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

code.description: Service-defined error code. This code serves as a sub-status for the HTTP error code specified in the response.

details.description: The list of invalid fields send in request, in case of validation error.

code.description: Property level error code.
